meanings.definition: Establish the truth or correctness of (something previously believed or suspected).
meanings.sent1: She needed to confirm if her guess was right.
meanings.sent2: Please confirm your attendance at the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The detective confirmed the suspect's alibi with evidence.
meanings.sent5: The loud applause confirmed the success of the performance.

meanings.definition: Make (a plan, arrangement, or agreement) definite or official.
meanings.sent1: Let's confirm the date for the party.
meanings.sent2: The contract needs to be confirmed by both parties.
meanings.sent4: The signature on the document confirmed the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The email confirmed the flight reservation.

meanings.definition: Administer the religious rite of confirmation to (someone).
meanings.sent1: The priest will confirm the children this Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The bishop confirmed the young adults in the church.
meanings.sent3: The ceremony confirmed their commitment to the faith.
meanings.sent4: The ritual confirmed their membership in the church.
meanings.sent5: The event confirmed their spiritual journey.
